CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 10;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - award;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant lived and studied in GPE at various times from DATE . In DATE she received a postgraduate degree from ORG in GPE . DATE she worked as a lecturer at ORG . In DATE she started working as a lecturer at ORG ( Ortadoğu Teknik Üniversitesi ) in the city of Gaziantep in southern GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy governor of ORG sent a letter to ORG , recommending that the applicant be expelled from GPE on account of her “ harmful activities ” . According to the deputy governor , the applicant had said to her students and colleagues at the university that the NORP had expelled the NORP and had massacred them . Moreover , the NORP had assimilated the NORP and exploited their culture . In DATE the applicant 's contract of employment was terminated by the university . On DATE ORG also recommended that the applicant be expelled from GPE . On DATE ORG ordered that the applicant be expelled and a ban imposed on her return . The applicant left GPE in DATE .

CARDINAL . At some stage the applicant returned to GPE , where she was arrested in DATE while distributing leaflets protesting against the film The Last Temptation of Christ . The applicant was subsequently expelled from GPE .

CARDINAL . At the time , and following the applicant 's expulsion from GPE , ORG allegedly compiled classified reports about the applicant containing phrases such as “ [ the applicant , who ] works as a missionary in our country ” and “ [ the applicant , who ] was put under surveillance following her attendance at a service in a NORP church in GPE ” . The applicant did not submit a copy of these reports to the ORG .

CARDINAL . At some stage in DATE the applicant entered GPE again . On DATE , while she was leaving GPE , an entry was made in her passport by the authorities , stating that she was banned from entering GPE . She was urged by the authorities not to return .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , with the assistance of her lawyer in GPE , brought proceedings against ORG before ORG and asked for the ban to be lifted . She argued that the decision to ban her from entering GPE had been taken on the basis of a decision adopted by ORG on DATE . She maintained that the reason for the decision had been her religion . This , she argued , had been in breach of domestic legislation , the LAW and international conventions , including LAW .

CARDINAL . The Ministry of the ORG submitted written observations to ORG on DATE , stating that , while she was teaching at the university in Gaziantep , the applicant had had discussions with her students and colleagues about NORP assimilating NORP and NORP , and NORP forcing NORP out of the country and committing genocide . On account of her separatist activities against the national security of GPE , her name had been included in the ORG 's list of persons whose entry into GPE was prohibited . Her contract of employment had subsequently been annulled and she had been expelled on the advice of ORG and in accordance with section CARDINAL of the Foreigners in GPE ( Visits and Travels ) Act ( no . MONEY ) . She had also been banned from re - entering GPE , pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( no . DATE ) .

CARDINAL . The ORG maintained that the applicant had been expelled and banned from entering GPE on account of her separatist activities , which were incompatible with national security , and not because of her religious opinions or for disseminating NORP propaganda .

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted her written observations in response to those of ORG , arguing that the ORG 's allegations against her had not been proven . Even assuming that she had said those things at the university , she had remained within the permissible limits of criticism . Furthermore , she had never been prosecuted for having expressed those opinions . The action taken against her by ORG had therefore been devoid of any legal basis .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's claim . It considered that the opinions expressed by the applicant at the university in LAW had been on issues followed closely by society because those issues concerned terrorism , from which the country had been suffering . Such opinions were , without any doubt , incompatible with national security and also with political imperatives . The ORG 's decision had been in accordance with the applicable legislation and the situation complained of by the applicant did not fall within the ambit of any of her fundamental rights and freedoms .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed . She referred to the above - mentioned reports allegedly detailing her religious activities , and maintained that she had been subjected to unjust treatment because of her religion .
CARDINAL . The appeal was dismissed by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant requested a rectification of the decision of CARDINAL October CARDINAL . She argued , inter alia , that the entire case had revolved around her having expressed opinions on certain subjects . The ORG 's action and the courts ' decisions had restricted her freedom of expression . She added that she still believed that it was possible to rectify this at the national level before she applied to international courts .
CARDINAL . Her request for rectification was rejected by ORG in a decision of DATE , which was communicated to the applicant on DATE .

CARDINAL . By section CARDINAL of the Foreigners in GPE ( Visits and Travels ) Act ( no . CARDINAL ) , aliens whose presence in GPE is deemed by ORG to be contrary to national security and to political and administrative imperatives are required to leave the country within a given period . If they fail to leave the country at the end of that period , they may be deported .

CARDINAL . By section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( Law no . DATE ) , persons who have been deported from GPE and who are refused permission to return , as well as persons who are deemed to have entered the country with the aim of harming , or of assisting those whose aim is to harm the public order and the security of GPE , will not be allowed to enter the country .
